segments.source_content: **It's flexible for Developers**: create your own design system using React components, add Visual editing in your JSX and add sidebar controls to edit props like the background color. Choose Next.js, Gatsby or Remix and any CSS framework you like!

translations.fr: **Flexible pour les dÃ©veloppeurs** : crÃ©ez votre propre systÃ¨me de design en utilisant des composants React, ajoutez l'Ã©dition visuelle dans votre JSX et des contrÃ´les dans la barre latÃ©rale pour modifier les props comme la couleur de fond. Choisissez Next.js, Gatsby ou Remix et n'importe quel framework CSS que vous aimez !
translations.en: **Flexible pour les dÃ©veloppeurs** : crÃ©ez votre propre systÃ¨me de design avec des composants React, ajoutez l'Ã©dition visuelle dans votre JSX et contrÃ´les latÃ©raux pour modifier les props comme la couleur de fond. Choisissez Next.js, Gatsby ou Remix et n'importe quel framework CSS !

segments.source_content: **It's easy for Content editors** who can directly edit in a visual way without breaking the design system: much easier than editing abstract entities using gray fields, as in a headless CMS. **And you save time**, as Content editors are autonomous!

translations.fr: **Facile pour les Ã©diteurs de contenu** qui peuvent Ã©diter directement de maniÃ¨re visuelle sans casser le systÃ¨me de design : bien plus simple que de modifier des entitÃ©s abstraites dans des champs gris comme avec un CMS headless. **Et vous gagnez du temps** car les Ã©diteurs de contenu sont autonomes !

segments.source_content: **It's enterprise-ready** with Collaboration, Time-machine, Single Sign-on, GDPR-compliant datacenters, Global CDN for optimized images, E-commerce integration, Scheduled publishing and more.

translations.fr: **PrÃªt pour l'entreprise** avec Collaboration, Time-machine, Single Sign-on, des datacenters conformes au RGPD, CDN global pour les images optimisÃ©es, intÃ©gration e-commerce, publication planifiÃ©e et plus encore.

segments.source_content: **[A Cure for useState Hell](https://www.builder.io/blog/use-reducer)**

translations.fr: **[Un remÃ¨de Ã  l'enfer de useState](https://www.builder.io/blog/use-reducer)**
translations.en: **[Un remÃ¨de Ã  l'enfer des useState](https://www.builder.io/blog/use-reducer)**

segments.source_content: Proposes to replace several `useState` with a `useReducer` with a single action. He explains the advantages, like the possibility to make sure the state is consistent, or to migrate later to a reducer with several actions. An interesting pattern to know. My opinion: it is quite possible to get similar benefits by using a single `useState` with a single object and a custom hook. `useState` or `useReducer` should be an implementation detail.

translations.fr: Propose de remplacer plusieurs `useState` par un `useReducer` avec une seule action. Il explique les avantages, comme la possibilitÃ© de garantir la cohÃ©rence de l'Ã©tat ou de migrer ultÃ©rieurement vers un rÃ©ducteur avec plusieurs actions. Un pattern intÃ©ressant Ã  connaÃ®tre. Mon avis : on peut obtenir des avantages similaires en utilisant un seul `useState` avec un objet unique et un hook personnalisÃ©. `useState` ou `useReducer` devrait Ãªtre un dÃ©tail d'implÃ©mentation.
translations.en: Propose de remplacer plusieurs `useState` par un `useReducer` avec une seule action. Il explique les avantages, comme la possibilitÃ© de garantir la cohÃ©rence de l'Ã©tat, ou de migrer vers un rÃ©ducteur avec plusieurs actions. Un pattern intÃ©ressant Ã  connaÃ®tre. Mon avis : on peut obtenir des bÃ©nÃ©fices similaires avec un seul `useState` contenant un objet et un hook personnalisÃ©. Le choix entre `useState` ou `useReducer` devrait rester un dÃ©tail d'implÃ©mentation.

segments.source_content: **[Type-safe React Query](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/type-safe-react-query)**

translations.fr: **[React Query type-safe](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/type-safe-react-query)**
translations.en: **[React Query en type-safe](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/type-safe-react-query)**

segments.source_content: With TypeScript, you'd rather not fool yourself. Can we trust our backend to return the right payload. Dominik suggests combining React-Query with Zod. With inference, it is no longer necessary to force a type with `as` or generics. We can use tRPC or Zodios in a fullstack environment when the backend and frontend are in the same monorepo.

translations.fr: Avec TypeScript, vous prÃ©fÃ©reriez ne pas vous tromper vous-mÃªme. Peut-on faire confiance Ã  notre backend pour renvoyer le bon payload ? Dominik suggÃ¨re de combiner React-Query avec Zod. GrÃ¢ce Ã  l'infÃ©rence, il n'est plus nÃ©cessaire de forcer un type avec `as` ou des gÃ©nÃ©riques. On peut utiliser tRPC ou Zodios dans un environnement fullstack lorsque le backend et le frontend sont dans le mÃªme monorepo.
translations.en: Avec TypeScript, mieux vaut ne pas se mentir. Peut-on faire confiance Ã  notre backend pour retourner le bon payload ? Dominik suggÃ¨re de combiner React-Query avec Zod. GrÃ¢ce Ã  l'infÃ©rence, plus besoin de forcer un type avec `as` ou des gÃ©nÃ©riques. On peut utiliser tRPC ou Zodios dans un environnement fullstack quand le backend et le frontend sont dans le mÃªme monorepo.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“œ [Data Binding in React](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/react/data-binding/): new interactive article by Josh Comeau on controlled inputs in React, including the subtleties to know about each type of input, or the use of ids for accessibility.
- ğŸ“œ [Async React with NextJS 13](https://swizec.com/blog/async-react-with-nextjs-13/): use of async Server Components in a Next.js 13 app, covering many interesting details like error boundaries, fetch extended by Next.js, React cache...
- ğŸ“œ [How to debounce and throttle in React without losing your mind](https://www.developerway.com/posts/debouncing-in-react): highlights that it is not so simple to implement debouncing in React: unstable debounced function, memoization, stale closure...
- ğŸ“œ [Why You Should Use a React Framework](https://leerob.substack.com/p/react-frameworks): Lee Robinson gives different reasons to use a framework, to dedicate more time to the product. React has evolved, and it is no longer just a library, but also an architecture, a community and an ecosystem.
- ğŸ“œ [Future of Storybook in 2023](https://storybook.js.org/blog/future-of-storybook-in-2023/): a 2022 retrospective and what to expect in 2023: Storybook 7.0, performance, Turbopack support, embeds, testing, improved React-Native support.
- ğŸ“œ [Storybook Ecosystem CI](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-ecosystem-ci/): new system that allows to detect in advance regressions linked to minor upgrades of transitive dependencies.
- ğŸ“œ [How We Rebuilt React DevTools with Replay Routines](https://blog.replay.io/how-we-rebuilt-react-devtools-with-replay-routines): Mark Erikson goes in depth on how React DevTools work, and how the new integration with the Replay time-travel debugger works.
- ğŸ“œ [Optimizing React performance without refs and memo](https://alexsidorenko.com/blog/react-optimize-rerenders-without-refs-memo/): proposes to optimize React re-renders by isolating code in a smaller component.
- ğŸ“œ [Why Vercel OG Is Amazing and How to Use It](https://www.flavienbonvin.com/why-vercel-og-is-amazing-and-how-to-use-it/): using a meta image is important for marketing. Vercel OG is an innovative solution using JSX and Tailwind, easy to integrate into a Next.js project deployed on Vercel.
- ğŸ“œ [Excalidraw - Rethinking the Component API](https://blog.excalidraw.com/redesigning-editor-api/): explains some React design decisions for the Excalidraw editor that remove the use of render props and replaces it with React.Children, a deprecated API.
- ğŸ“œ [Building a fast, animated image gallery with Next.js](https://vercel.com/blog/building-a-fast-animated-image-gallery-with-next-js)
- ğŸ“œ [React, Vite and TypeScript: Get started in under 2 minutes](https://blog.nrwl.io/react-vite-and-typescript-get-started-in-under-2-minutes-3bd5cd836175)
- ğŸ“œ [A guide to streaming SSR with React 18](https://blog.logrocket.com/streaming-ssr-with-react-18/)
- ğŸ“œ [Little React Things: React applications are functions](https://www.zekehernandez.com/posts/react-applications-are-functions)
- ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ“ [New official Relay tutorial](https://twitter.com/RelayFramework/status/1611424289068314625)
- ğŸ‘€ [Remix + Vanilla Extract PR - merged](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/pull/5040)
- ğŸ¦ [Solid in React](https://twitter.com/RyanCarniato/status/1611448920521179136): Ryan Carniato's POC to integrate a SolidJS component into a React app
- ğŸ“¦ [Remix 1.10](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.10.0): the official end of the "React-Routering Remix" project and many new useful hooks.
- ğŸ“¦ [create-react-signals](https://github.com/dai-shi/create-react-signals): Daishi Kato inspired by Preact signals to create new reactive bindings for Zustand, Valtio and Jotai.
- ğŸ“¦ [Mutative](https://github.com/unadlib/mutative) + [Structura.js](https://giusepperaso.github.io/structura.js): 2 new faster alternatives to Immer for immutable updates?
- ğŸ“¦ [Redux Toolkit 2.0 alpha](https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-toolkit/releases/tag/v2.0.0-alpha.0): gives an idea of upcoming v2 breaking changes
- ğŸ“¦ [Create-Universal-App](https://github.com/chen-rn/CUA): starter to create universal fullstack apps (web + mobile): Next.js, Expo, Tamagui, tRPC...
- ğŸ“¦ [Chakra UI FigPilot](https://twitter.com/chakra_ui/status/1613267652717191191): transform Figma design to Chakra UI
- ğŸ“¦ [Inertia 1.0](https://twitter.com/inertiajs/status/1614295060610437123): PHP framework from Tailwind co-creator using server side routing and React integration.
- ğŸ“¦ [Precedent](https://twitter.com/steventey/status/1613928948915920896): "Building blocks for Next.js"
- ğŸ“¦ [MDX extension for VSCode 1.1](https://twitter.com/remcohaszing/status/1613910319805382657): experimental intellisense support
- ğŸ“¦ [Next.js 13.1.2](https://twitter.com/nextjs/status/1613910922128416768)
- ğŸ“¦ [Radix releases - January 17](https://www.radix-ui.com/docs/primitives/overview/releases#january-17-2023)
- ğŸ“¦ [Visx 3.0](https://github.com/airbnb/visx/releases/tag/v3.0.0)
- ğŸ¥ [Did NextJS 13 Break State Management?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OpMAH2hzKi8)
- ğŸ¥ [Blazing Fast Tips: React & TypeScript](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=37PafxU_uzQ)
- ğŸ¥ [Is it Too Late To Learn React?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WByOlXWrGaY)

segments.source_content: **[React Native 0.71: TypeScript by Default, Flexbox Gap, and more...](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/01/12/version-071)**

translations.fr: **[React Native 0.71 : TypeScript par dÃ©faut, Flexbox Gap, et plus encore...](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/01/12/version-071)**
translations.en: **[React Native 0.71 : TypeScript par dÃ©faut, Flexbox Gap, et plus encore...](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/01/12/version-071)**

segments.source_content: A big release with among other things:

translations.fr: Une version majeure comprenant notamment :
translations.en: Une version majeure comprenant notamment :

segments.source_content:
- TypeScript by default
- Flex gap support in pixels (percentage support is coming later)
- New web-inspired props (accessibility, style, events) that should simplify cross-platform dev.
- Improved DX: click-to-inspect DevTools, new Hermes version, new architecture...
- [Android Prebuilts on Maven Central](https://github.com/reactwg/react-native-new-architecture/discussions/105): Android build time reduced by 94%, and various other impacts. Note: it could be possible to [greatly improve iOS build times](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1611527618444120065) as well.

translations.fr:
- TypeScript par dÃ©faut
- Prise en charge des Ã©carts Flex en pixels (le support des pourcentages arrivera plus tard)
- Nouvelles props inspirÃ©es du web (accessibilitÃ©, style, Ã©vÃ©nements) qui devraient simplifier le dÃ©veloppement multiplateforme.
- AmÃ©lioration de l'expÃ©rience dÃ©veloppeur : inspection au clic dans DevTools, nouvelle version d'Hermes, nouvelle architecture...
- [PrÃ©compilations Android sur Maven Central](https://github.com/reactwg/react-native-new-architecture/discussions/105) : temps de build Android rÃ©duit de 94%, et divers autres impacts. Note : il serait possible [d'amÃ©liorer considÃ©rablement les temps de build iOS](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1611527618444120065).
translations.en:
- TypeScript par dÃ©faut
- Support du gap Flexbox en pixels (le support en pourcentage viendra plus tard)
- Nouvelles props inspirÃ©es du web (accessibilitÃ©, style, Ã©vÃ©nements) qui devraient simplifier le dÃ©veloppement multiplateforme.
- DX amÃ©liorÃ© : inspecteur clic dans les DevTools, nouvelle version d'Hermes, nouvelle architecture...
- [PrÃ©compilÃ©s Android sur Maven Central](https://github.com/reactwg/react-native-new-architecture/discussions/105) : temps de build Android rÃ©duit de 94%, et divers autres impacts. Note : il serait possible d'[amÃ©liorer considÃ©rablement les temps de build iOS](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1611527618444120065) Ã©galement.

segments.source_content: **Various new articles on the Expo blog**:

translations.fr: **Plusieurs nouveaux articles sur le blog Expo** :
translations.en: **Plusieurs nouveaux articles sur le blog d'Expo** :

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ‘€ SDK 48 should be released at the end of February.
- ğŸ“œ [Announcing General Availability of M1 workers on EAS Build](https://blog.expo.dev/m1-workers-on-eas-build-dcaa2c1333ad): the M1 worker reduces iOS build time by -40% on EAS and will soon become the default worker.
- ğŸ“œ [An Implementation Change to Expo Push Notification Service for Android Notifications](https://blog.expo.dev/an-implementation-change-to-expo-push-notification-service-for-android-notifications-ede056189e33): the Expo API will no longer tell you if the push was received by APNS or FCM.
- ğŸ“œ [Testing React Native from the nightly builds](https://blog.expo.dev/testing-react-native-from-the-nightly-builds-ee54ad0c9830): uses the current dev version of React-Native to detect issues as soon as possible.
- ğŸ“œ [Classic Build service no longer supported](https://blog.expo.dev/classic-build-service-no-longer-supported-73c82b500f56): you have to switch to EAS or build yourself with `turtle-cli`.

segments.source_content: The TLDR newsletter is hiring its first engineer to help build out the hiring platform along with other internal projects. Looking for someone with experience shipping side projects or on small teams, with experience in Next.js and Postgres/Supabase.

Recherche une personne ayant de l'expÃ©rience dans le dÃ©ploiement de projets annexes ou au sein de petites Ã©quipes, avec une expertise dans Next.js et Postgres/Supabase.

segments.source_content: Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.
